Description: Papyrus written with black ink, demotic legal document dated to month of Thoth of year 21 of Ptolemy II Philadelphos with 4 witness copies. On verso, names of 16 witnesses. Neskhonsu daughter of Teos' will as sale of property (houses and choachyte's offices) to eldest son Panas son of Pkhorkhonsis in return for lifelong rations and burial costs. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "imperfect at the right side, complete on left. Writing in about 10 lines to each of 5 copies (A-E) of which A & B are incomplete, C-E are complete".
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.187) (genealogy)
Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.16-22, pl.1-7, 10)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (310) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/310)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached Black ink Tabbed: brown paper Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Frame: wood Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.Brit.Mus. IV 1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
